page.title: 18Schools in Barnburgh
page.content: Parish records show that there was a school in Barnburgh in 1740, and there some evidence of earlier educational establishments. In 1840 a National School was set up, which survived as a school until 1878,and as building until 1912. A Board School was built in 1878,which served the needs of the village until 1956. The building is now demolished,but the Headmaster's house still stands. Village expansion resulted in a new school being built in 1956,which had peak population of 250 in 1975. Today the school has some 200 children aged 5 to 12, arranged in 8 classes. As we sit infront of our B.B.C. Micro typing in this page of information we can imagine the great changes that have occurred since 1740.
